timeline.message: Move method, also fix a dumb bug
Always compute types for literal trees

timeline.bodyText: Why was this change necessary? It seems unrelated to the other work in this PR.
timeline.author: kelloggm

replies.bodyText:
Without this, the interaction between the Initialized Fields Checker and the Index Checker fails, because the Initialized Fields Checker calls this (transitively) with iUseFlow set to false.
Literals don't depend on flow, so this change seems safe.
replies.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: This isn't quite true - every type system that has an annotation that is inconsistent with null, 0, or false is unsound. Those that do not (such as e.g. the Tainting Checker) aren't unsound.
timeline.author: kelloggm
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,172 @@
+\htmlhr
+\chapterAndLabel{Initialized Fields Checker}{initialized-fields-checker}
+
+The Initialized Fields Checker warns if a constructor does not initialize a
+field.
+If you run it together with other checkers (by supplying multiple checkers
+to the \<-processor> command-line option), then it issues warnings only if
+the default value assigned by Java (0, true, or null) is not consistent
+with the field's annotation, for the other checkers.
+% It's actually the checkers and their subcheckers if any.  Saying that
+% would be confusing to most users, who don't know what a "subchecker" is.
+% The term "subchecker" appears only in the "creating a checker" section of
+% the manual.
+
+An example invocation is
+
+\begin{Verbatim}
+javac -processor ValueChecker,InitializedFieldsChecker MyFile.java
+\end{Verbatim}
+
+
+\sectionAndLabel{Motivation:  uninitialized fields}{initialized-fields-motivation}
+
+Without the Initialized Fields Checker, every type system (except the

replies.bodyText: It might be okay to leave this as-is, though, because bringing up that detail might make this too wordy.
replies.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText: I think you can replace this with executableElement.getKind() == ElementKind.CONSTRUCTOR to avoid the string comparison
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText:
The default value for booleans in Java is false, not true. This should probably also mention 0.0, which is the default for floating point types.
I think the code gets this right, but this documentation is wrong.
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText: The default value for booleans is false, not true
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText: Why can't you add this default? It would just be adding default {"this} to the end of this line, right?
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText: Why do you need InitializedFieldsPredicate? I can't think of a situation where it would be useful.
timeline.author: kelloggm

replies.bodyText: (There is a constructor in AccumulationAnnotatedTypeFactory that doesn't require a predicate annotation.)
replies.author: kelloggm

timeline.author: kelloggm

replies.bodyText: The whitespace was wrong before; this makes it line up in the generated HTML.  I could move it into a different pull request if you prefer.
replies.author: mernst

timeline.bodyText: Does this new constructor remove the need for the suppress warnings above?
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.bodyText: What's the subtyping relationship between @InitializedFields annotations?
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: The processor list can contain classes that are not BaseTypeCheckers.  Those class should be ignored rather than cause an exception.
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: If you just want to check primary annotations, then you can call QualifierHierarchy#isSubtype.   But the fieldType might be a type variable in which case, the field type might not have a primary annotation.  So, what you have written is correct.  (I would delete this comment.)
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: contracts.postcondition.not.satisfied should have the checker name prefix.  Also, no need to add value = .
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: I think these fields are still included in the returned array.  It's just that dataflow visits initialization block or static initialization block as part of the constructor.  So, I would delete this bullet point.
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: What does @EnsuresInitializedFields(value = {"this", "a"}, fields = { "c", "d"}) mean?  I think that value should just be a string.  Then @EnsuresInitializedFields should be repeatable.
timeline.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: This seems wrong to me.  I'm assuming there's a problem because of the LiteralTrees created by the Initialized Fields Checker.  I'll see if I can find a better work around.
timeline.author: smillst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1633,7 +1634,7 @@ protected final void addComputedTypeAnnotations(Tree tree, AnnotatedTypeMirror t
      */
     protected void addComputedTypeAnnotations(
             Tree tree, AnnotatedTypeMirror type, boolean iUseFlow) {
-        assert root != null
+        assert root != null || tree instanceof LiteralTree

replies.bodyText: @smillst That is correct.  The synthetic LiteralTrees lack some information, such as a path in source code.  There are a few hard-coded checks for LiteralTree in this pull request.  Fixing that would be nice.
replies.author: mernst

replies.bodyText: I was able to remove these.  See my last commit.
replies.author: smillst

timeline.bodyText: I think this is done, so this line can be removed.
timeline.author: kelloggm

timeline.message: Don't use flow to compute the type of default values.
Merge branch 'initializedfields' of github.com:mernst/checker-framework into initializedfields

timeline.bodyText: The Collections.singletonList returns an immutable list, so clients can't side-effect it.
timeline.author: smillst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -809,6 +811,43 @@ public NoSuchElementException(String message) { return result; } + /** + * Get the element with the name {@code elementName} of the annotation {@code anno}. The element + * has type {@code expectedType} or array of {@code expectedType}. + * + *

Parameter useDefaults is used to determine whether default values should be used for + * annotation values. Finding defaults requires more computation, so should be false when no + * defaulting is needed. + * + * @param anno the annotation to disassemble + * @param elementName the name of the element to access + * @param expectedType the expected type used to cast the return type + * @param the class of the expected type + * @param useDefaults whether to apply default values to the element + * @return the value of the element with the given name; it is a new list, so it is safe for

timeline.message: Merge branch 'initializedfields' of github.com:mernst/checker-framework into initializedfields

Initialized Fields Checker

It does no enforcement yet
Support accumulation for an arbitrary Receiver, not just for a Node
Support accumulation for an arbitrary Receiver, not just for a Node
Move ContractsUtils instance from visitor to type factory
Add a synthetic postcondition to constructors (checkpoint)
Add a synthetic postcondition to constructors
Clarify when a checker shorthand is applied
Move Aliasing Checker chapter later in manual
